p: Dengue virus (DENV) is an arbovirus that belongs to the Flaviviridae family, Flavivirus genus, and is transmitted to humans by mosquitoes from genera Aedes. Four genetically related but antigenically distinct DENV serotypes have been described: DENV-1, DENV-2, DENV-3, and DENV-4. Besides Brazil, DENV is widely distributed across tropical and subtropical areas of the world [ 6].
